alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 3:53AM EDT until July 21 at 5:30AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHERN WAYNE COUNTY... At 353 AM EDT, Doppler radar and precipitation gauges indicated that between 3 and 4 inches of rain had fallen since midnight. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. The heaviest rainfall has ended; however, excessive runoff will continue through 5 am. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monticello, Cooper, Slickford, Burfield, Oil Valley, Mount Pisgah, Hidalgo, Barrier, Susie, Powersburg, Parmleysville, Coopersville, Rockeybranch, Zula, Griffin, Sunnybrook, Cabell, Kidds Crossing and Ritner. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
